New Records: Lionel Messi became the second highest all-time international menâ€™s goalscorer with 109 goals, surpassing Ali Daei.
Argentina reached their fourth Copa America final in five years.
Key Match Events: Argentina opened the scoring with a goal by Julian Alvarez after a foul by Canada.
Lionel Messi scored the second goal with a redirect after a combination with Rodrigo De Paul and Enzo Fernandez.
Canada struggled to finish despite creating chances, leading to their defeat.
Post-Match Reflections: Jesse Marsch, Canada's coach, emphasized the tournament's challenges and the team's future development.
Marsch expressed pride in the team's performance and optimism for future success.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Argentina will face the winner of Uruguay vs. Colombia in the final on July 14.
Canada will play in the third-place game against the winner of Uruguay vs. Colombia on July 13.
Others: Alphonso Davies was forced to leave the game due to an injury.
The article highlighted the progress of Argentina and the challenges faced by Canada in the tournament.
